Key Arguments: The government and experts have provided poor or misleading information on various subjects.
Education should focus on teaching children how to think critically rather than indoctrinating them with specific viewpoints.
Access to a wide range of views and information is essential for making informed decisions.
The proposal could limit the ability to access diverse perspectives.
Main Themes: Distrust in government and expert information
Importance of critical thinking and education
Freedom of information and access to diverse viewpoints
Criticism of past government narratives and misinformation
Notable Quotes: Without the ability to see a wide range of views and information on ANY topic no one CAN make a free OR informed decision on anything.
Just about everything that I was told at school as fact has turned out to be not only wrong but outright lies.
